org.fluidity.deployment.plugin.spi

Interface JarManifest


  • public interface JarManifest
    JAR manifest transformation for application wrappers. The org.fluidity.maven:standalone-jar-maven-plugin Maven plugin can be configured with an implementation of this interface to transform the manifest file of the host project.

    The implementation must be registered in a JAR service provider file for the above plugin to find the implementation.

    The execution environment of the implementation is the execution environment of a Maven plugin.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  JarManifest.Dependencies
      Handles the dependencies of the host project.
      static class  JarManifest.Packaging
      Maven profile names for the implementation project to declare dependencies not to include, to include, or to unpack, respectively, in the project artifact being processed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CREATED_BY
      Manifest header that identifies the tool that created the archive.
      static String FRAMEWORK_ID
      Identifies Fluid Tools as the creator of standalone archives; to be used with the CREATED_BY manifest header.

    • Method Detail

      • processManifest

        SecurityPolicy processManifest(org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject project,
                               Attributes attributes,
                               SecurityPolicy policy,
                               org.fluidity.deployment.maven.Logger log,
                               JarManifest.Dependencies dependencies)
                        throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
        Transforms the provided main manifest attributes of the given Maven project.

        The org.fluidity.maven:standalone-jar-maven-plugin Maven plugin packages the host project's run-time dependencies into the project artifact, including the original project artifact itself, before invoking this method. If the receiver is the first handler configured for the project, it can call JarManifest.Dependencies.attribute(String, String) to specify the attribute name under which the packaged dependency list will be available at run time. When not invoked, the default attribute name is Archives.Nested.attribute(null). Secondary handler may not call that method.

        Parameters:
        project - the Maven project to extract metadata from.
        attributes - the main manifest attributes.
        policy - the security policy that that manages Java security permissions; never null.
        log - the logger to send messages to.
        dependencies - allows the receiver to handle project dependencies.
        Returns:
        the policy processor for the caller to use in place of the one supplied to this method; may be null, in which case the supplied one will be used by the caller.
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - when processing the manifest fails.
